titles.title: Sea of Okhotsk Fisheries Enforcement Act of 1995
To amend the Central Bering Sea Fisheries Enforcement Act of 1992 to prohibit fishing in the Central Sea of Okhotsk by vessels and nationals of the United States.

action.text: Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife and Oceans Prior to Introduction and Referral.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife and Oceans.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-42.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 22.

action.text: Mr. Young (AK) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 1/26/1995--Introduced. Sea of Okhotsk Fisheries Enforcement Act of 1995 - Amends the Central Bering Sea Fisheries Enforcement Act of 1992 to prohibit U.S. vessels and nationals from fishing in the Central Sea of Okhotsk except in accordance with an international fishery agreement to which the United States and the Russian Federation are parties.
